alert.note: Alert for Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 5:11PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Haskell, southeastern Sequoyah and north central Le Flore Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 511 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 3 miles northwest of Keota, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Spiro... Panama... Keota... Bokoshe... Shady Point... Cowlington... Kanima... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Oklahoma.
